ablaze.translation[0].definitions[0].def: burning strongly with a lot of flames
ablaze.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Within minutes the whole house was ablaze.
The factory had been set ablaze  (=made to burn).
ablaze.translation[0].definitions[0].not: Ablaze is mostly used in journalism or in literature. In everyday English, people usually say on fire:
The whole house was on fire.
ablaze.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: a passing pleasure-boat, with all its lights ablaze
Her yard was ablaze with summer flowers.
ablaze.translation[0].definitions[2].def: feeling or showing strong emotion, especially anger
ablaze.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: His eyes were ablaze with fury.
